Back again with more swerve issues! It’s finally in a almost working state though! So, in this code: \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/Mateo-Johnson/swerg\" class=\"inline-onebox\" rel=\"noopener nofollow ugc\"\u003eGitHub - Mateo-Johnson/swerg\u003c/a\u003e, when we power cycle, the modules don’t move to zero. The offsets are correct, and I think it is something to do with my SyncEncoders() function, but I can’t put my finger on it. The modules just accept where they are as the new 0.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIn addition to this, the robot will not turn! I think it is something to do with the inversion of the driving motors, but they all turn to the right angle, but then they seem to be counteracting each others drive.
